text.2_Daf, 14_Line: — He informs us this: they merely do not free their owners of their obligation. yet they retain their [original] sanctity, and no alteration therein is permitted,
text.2_Daf, 20_Line: And if you wish, I can say [it follows] from Scripture:
text.2_Daf, 11_Line: IF ONE SLAUGHTERED A FIRSTLING OR TITHE IN THE NAME OF A PEACE-OFFERING, IT IS VALID; IF ONE SLAUGHTERED A PEACE-OFFERING IN THE NAME OF A FIRSTLING OR TITHE, IT IS INVALID.
text.2_Daf, 10_Line: IF ONE SLAUGHTERED MOST SACRED SACRIFICES UNDER THE DESIGNATION OF LESSER SACRIFICES, THEY ARE INVALID; IF ONE SLAUGHTERED LESSER SACRIFICES UNDER THE DESIGNATION OF MOST SACRED SACRIFICES, THEY ARE VALID.
text.2_Daf, 15_Line: in accordance with Raba's dictum. For Raba said:
text.2_Daf, 18_Line: If you wish, I can say [this follows] from reason:
text.2_Daf, 8_Line: IF ONE SLAUGHTERED THEM UNDER A HIGHER DESIGNATION THAN THEIR OWN THEY ARE VALID; UNDER A LOWER DESIGNATION THAN THEIR OWN, THEY ARE INVALID.
text.2_Daf, 6_Line: [SACRIFICES] SLAUGHTERED IN THE NAME OF A PASSOVER-OFFERING OR A SIN-OFFERING ARE INVALID.
text.2_Daf, 12_Line: [Gemarah]  Why must [the Tanna] teach, SAVE THAT THEY DO NOT FREE [THEIR OWNERS OF THEIR OBLIGATION];
text.2_Daf, 2_Line: ALSO THE GUILT-OFFERING [IS INVALID]. [AND THE LAW HOLDS GOOD OF] A PASSOVER-OFFERING IN ITS PROPER TIME, AND A SIN-OFFERING AND A GUILT-OFFERING AT ALL TIMES.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line: THE SIN-OFFERING COMES ON ACCOUNT OF SIN, AND THE GUILT-OFFERING COMES ON ACCOUNT OF SIN: AS A SIN-OFFERING [ SLAUGHTERED] NOT IN ITS OWN NAME IS INVALID, SO IS THE GUILT-OFFERING INVALID [SLAUGHTERED] NOT IN ITS OWN NAME.
text.2_Daf, 21_Line: That which is gone out of thy lips thou shalt observe and do; according as thou hast vowed a freewill-offering unto the Lord thy God etc.:(Deuteronomy 23:24)
text.2_Daf, 13_Line: let him teach, ‘and they do not free their owners of their obligation?’
text.2_Daf, 17_Line: If you wish, I can say [this follows] from reason, and if you wish I can say, from Scripture.
text.2_Daf, 16_Line: If a burnt-offering was slaughtered under a different designation, its blood must not be sprinkled under a different designation.
text.2_Daf, 19_Line: because he made an alteration therein [once], is he to go on making alterations therein?
text.2_Daf, 0_Line: [Mishnah]  ALL SACRIFICES SLAUGHTERED NOT IN THEIR OWN NAME ARE VALID, SAVE THAT THEY DO NOT FREE THEIR OWNERS OF THEIR OBLIGATION, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE PASSOVER-OFFERING AND THE SIN-OFFERING. [THIS HOLDS GOOD OF] A PASSOVER-OFFERING IN ITS PROPER TIME; AND A SIN-OFFERING AT ALL TIMES.
